H0.text: The sun is the most important source of electromagnetic waves on Earth.

H1.text: Clouds are the most important source of electromagnetic waves on Earth.

H2.text: The ocean is the most important source of electromagnetic waves on Earth.

H3.text: The moon is the most important source of electromagnetic waves on earth.

A4.text: The Sun radiating the energy from its surface mainly as visible light and infrared radiation with 10% at ultraviolet energies.

A5.text: Sunlight at the top of Earth's atmosphere is composed (by total energy) of about 50% infrared light, 40% visible light, and 10% ultraviolet light.
